title: Brigitte Bardot: A Famous Actress Who Loved Animals
summary: Brigitte Bardot was a French actress who became very famous in the 1950s and 1960s. She starred in movies like 'And God Created Woman,' which made her a big star around the world. Bardot was known for her beauty and her roles that showed women as free and strong. She also started fashion trends with her hair and makeup. Later in her life, she stopped acting to help animals. She started a foundation to protect animals from hunting and testing. Bardot lived in Saint-Tropez and focused on her animal rights work until she died at age 91. Her life was full of glamour, movies, and helping animals.

background_read: Brigitte Bardot was a famous actress from France who lived from 1934 to 2025. She became a star in the 1950s with movies that showed new ideas about women. Later, she used her fame to help animals by starting a foundation. This article talks about her life, from her early days as a ballerina to her work as an activist. It shows how she changed from being a movie icon to someone who cared deeply about animal rights.
